title_sort: walt whitman to f. leypoldt, 23 july 1877
title: Walt Whitman to F. Leypoldt, 23 July 1877
text: 431 Stevens Street Camden N JNew JerseyJuly 23 '77F Leypoldt Dear SirIn answer to your circular I send you the following—My works as they now stand (in the latest edition published by me at Camden N JNew Jersey about a year ago, June 1876) consist of Two VolumesLEAVES OF GRASS, copyrighted 1876, 384 pages 12 mo, (with portraits)—The first edition 72 pages, small quarto, was pubpublished in Brooklyn N YNew York in 1855—Second New York City 1857—third 1860 (by Thayer & Eldridge Boston)—fourth New York City 1865—fifth Washington D C 1871—Sixth & last as above.(—all the editions except the third by me)TWO RIVULETS, copyrighted 1876, 350 pages 12 mo. with photo.—including Democratic Vistas, Memoranda of the War, and Passage to IndiaI publish & sell these Vols.Volumes at $5 a piece. Each VolVolume contains autograph & portrait—I enclose proofs of the title pages of the above two Vols.Volumes Also a circular or advadvertisement. If needed will cheerfully furnish you any further information on the matter—Address me here—Walt Whitman Walt Whitman to F. Leypoldt, 23 July 1877
